experience:
[{'institution_name': 'Awake Security', 'linkedin_url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/18124959/', 'website': None, 'industry': None, 'type': None, 'headquarters': None, 'company_size': None, 'founded': None, 'from_date': 'Apr 2014', 'to_date': 'Present', 'description': 'Backed by Greylock and Bain Capital Ventures, Awake created a platform empowering teams to discover and investigate many of the threats and activities that traditionally evade security products and practitioners. The platform was developed after a year of deep analysis of SoC workflows and teams across several dozen very large scale enterprises. 

The following are a sample of technological advancements I developed the initial ideas for and/or was a core contributor (most with patents [pending]). 

- Using "consequential artifacts" to fingerprint devices and users from the edge of the network, enabling accurate and passive tracking as their IP addresses change (without the need for DHCP logs), enabling very long term behavioral analytics

- Using SSL to identify applications and malware (in 2014, before the publishing other similar great projects) 

- Identifying a user’s *role* in the enterprise based on their network traffic

- Algorithms to identify "notably suspicious" behavior or artifacts from a device - equally effective at insider threat detection as traditional threats

- Fingerprinting applications based on network traffic, and further identifying if that application is configured as a service, autostart on logon, or was executed by a user (again, only from network traffic) 

- Methodologies for automatically identifying network topologies

- Algorithms to identify how devices are similar to each other, useful for advanced threat detection (for both human analysts and machine automation)

- Strategies for integrating a variety of types and sources of analytics to automatically assess the risk of devices, in an approach similar to the ways human analysts cognitively identify the types of threats frequently missed by security products

- Passive detection of route hijack (and compromised border routers), even without direct observability of the hijacked route
